questions.question: What is the key difference between supervised and unsupervised learning?

options.A: Supervised learning uses only input data; unsupervised learning uses only output data
options.B: Supervised learning requires labeled data; unsupervised learning does not require labels
options.C: Unsupervised learning always outperforms supervised learning

questions.question: **(Medium, Select all that apply):** Which of the following are examples of unsupervised learning tasks in natural language processing?
In supervised learning, what are X and Y typically referring to?

options.A: X is the output, Y is the input
options.B: X is the input (features), Y is the output (labels)
options.C: Both X and Y are labels
options.D: X is always the document, Y is always the topic

questions.question: **(Medium, Select all that apply):** Which of the following statements are true about unsupervised learning?

options.A: The algorithm organizes the data based on features
options.B: There are no labels provided for the data
options.C: It requires a labeled training set
options.D: It is used to uncover natural groupings or latent dimensions

questions.question: What is the main objective of topic modeling?

options.A: Assign each document to a single group
options.B: Uncover latent topics or themes across a corpus and quantify their relevance to each document
options.C: Predict the sentiment of each document
options.D: Label documents with a predefined category

questions.question: **(Medium, Select all that apply):** Which of the following are characteristics of topic modeling as described in the materials?

options.A: Each document can be associated with multiple topics
options.B: Each document receives a relevance score for every topic
options.C: Each document is assigned only one label
options.D: The number of topics is usually determined by the user

questions.question: What distinguishes clustering from topic modeling in document analysis?

options.A: Clustering assigns each document to only one group, while topic modeling allows multiple topic associations
options.B: Clustering is supervised, topic modeling is unsupervised
options.C: Topic modeling uses labels, clustering does not
options.D: Clustering is only used for images

questions.question: **(Medium, Select all that apply):** According to the lecture, what are typical outputs of a topic modeling procedure?

options.A: A set of topics for the entire corpus
options.B: A relevance score for each topic in each document
options.C: A single label for each document
options.D: A list of all unique words in the corpus

questions.question: According to the instructor, what is a good rule of thumb before applying unsupervised learning?

options.B: Check if a supervised procedure is possible, as it usually produces better output
options.C: Never use supervised learning for text

questions.question: **(Hard, Select all that apply):** Which of the following are common unsupervised machine learning tasks applied to unstructured data?
